newsitem.title: RUSSIA: People freeze, cats frazzle in Kazakh town.
newsitem.headline: People freeze, cats frazzle in Kazakh town.

text.p: Three cats cut off the heating supply to a town in the freezing steppes of Kazakhstan, leaving residents shivering for at least six hours.

"The naughty cats chose to play in the transformer of the substation which supplies the boiler with electricity and unexpectedly short-circuited the system," Russia's Itar-Tass news agency said on Thursday.
"It only took an hour to discover the cause of the accident, but by then the boiler's element had gone out. It took at least six hours to get the water heated up again."
The water supplies heat to most of the 110,000 residents of the town of Taldy-Kurgan under the centralised system established across the former Soviet Union under communism.
The cats were killed by the electric shock.
